title: Frostfang is still a 500 gold sink
body:
Put the gold income back to 4, right now it's a total waste and considering Frostqueen is garbage compared to Talisman, it's really not worth upgrading it in any possible case.

Remember when Coin was useless trash that no one ever bought except if you could instantly upgrade it to T2-T3 and you buffed it and now it is actually a viable choice?

Yeah, let's do that to Frostfang too?

replies.body: My thoughts exactly.  Of course, Riot already knows it's trash.  Even their analysts have said so multiple times during LCS.  Problem is the balance team is both bad at their job and frankly doesn't care.  All their changes are 100% biased anyways.

It feels like the balance team does not play the game. You need special people that fit the role to even be qualified for that job. Someone objective, not your uncle or your friend or your math teacher from 3rd grade. Someone that can play the champ they are changing a couple hundred times and make a fair justified change to make the game better.

Most people that have been on the balance team over the years have been people like:

- Friend's of Riot employees from other companies (that aren't mobas)
- General hires from other gaming companies that again, aren't moba related
- People moving from say, Support or the Art department
- Interns that got placed into the position because Riot wanted to keep them, but not in the position they started.

It is no surprised that the balancing has been so awkward, because a lot of the people that move into it have no idea how balance in any game works, let alone this one specifically, or come from completely different departments, sometimes in completely different jobs.

The fact is, Riot says they want someone who IS a Rioter, not someone who will become one, but all that means is "someone we like or are already friends with", because that is where a lot of the outside hires legit come from. *cough* Ghostcrawler*cough*

On that note, it's worth mentioning Fearless admitted from the very beginning that he has never played Sona, rarely ever played against her and yet he was allowed to lead her ~~gutting~~ "rework"?

RIOT LOGIC.

shes not gutted, as a support unless u get hard countered you can be plenty effective. But yeah i agree that hiring your brother in law that does not play the game to lead reworks on champions we know and love is borderline criminal.

Fearless stated that he took on the task because he claimed to have "thick skin" and would not be bothered by negative feedback.  The last time he bothered posting on these forums something like 7 months ago, he said he is reluctant to do so because of the unanimously bad criticism that has been directed at him.  The sheer hypocrisy of his words is disconcerting.  Fact of the matter is, once it hit Live, he abandoned it completely and entirely.  He then proceeded to create the exact same debacle in the jungle changes at the beginning of this season.  Fearless has a proven track record of nothing, but failure and half-assed work.

Well I am no Sona expert though I think they could at least buff her E to give +2% ms per point spent on it.. instead of 1...
Like seriously.... Sona E gets more power from the 3 points you put into R then the 4 points you put into it after the first....

leveling R gives E between 2-6% increase MS
Leveling E gives E between 1-4% increase MS... like putting points into it is so pointless... like yes I know you aren't supposed to be leveling it... but you have to eventually....

Frost fang itself is fine.

Frost queen is just bad. 

Really bad.

frostfang is great actually. it increases the on-hit damage to 15 which is pretty underrated and it gives more mana regen.  it's frost queen that's garbage.

you buy spellthief's line to win lane more than anything. i dont think its supposed to scale well.
The sad part is, we all know the reason Frost Queen's Claim has to be so shit: if it wasn't shit, AP midlaners would buy it and abuse the fuck out of it. We've danced this dance before.

the T2 of the item is good actually, if you rush it and buy a green ward instead of rushing the sighstone, it will give you back 1.2 k gold by the time you need to sell it for slot efficency (wich is 40 minutes into the game)

You're going to proc it 240 times in less than 40 minutes?  That's not even mathematically possible.

For argument's sake, let's assume you got it at 10 minutes.  At 3 charges per half-minute for 30 minutes, the most you could possibly earn in an impossibly ideal scenario is 900 gold from 210 procs.  This is all assuming that you spend ever single half-minute of the game in perpetual combat with enemy champs/structures of at least 3 damage trades.  Meanwhile never killing a single minion to ensure the passive doesn't deactivate.  Even if you could miraculously accomplish half of that, it still wouldn't justify the initial investment.

It's a matter-of-fact, Frostfang is an unbuyable item unless Riot raises its gold/10 back up to 4.

you are forgetting the gold/second it gives you. 

Also it gives you mana and a bit of ap.

edit: we all know it's sub-par with the other items but It's not a complete waste of money.
stats+gold/sec+gold per proc gives it a >100% gold efficency
I usually take it on morgana since she's good at using that item and I sell it when I need to complete the NLR for the zhonya, otherwise it would be impossible for a support to make 1.6 k gold in one go

I didn't forget anything.  Frostfang does not give more gold/10 than Spellthief's, there's no reason for me to waste my time adding +0 or multiplying by 1.

The +5 AP is beyond negligible, especially when considering how abysmally low support scalings have become.  As for the mana regen, 2 charms will give you twice as much for less cost and are necessary for building into Idol or Chalice.

Frostfang is a useless waste of gold, no amount of narrow-mindedness can change that mathematical fact.

why would i pick an AP support like Zyra or Sona if the spellthief line is bad while the relic/coin is good?

i'd just go with Thresh-Janna that can start with their core item without gimping themselves (actually Janna can go spellthief-talisman because...well because she's Janna)

Because 1. the champion is not just the sum of their items and 2. champion selection isn't done in a vacuum. Even if Janna + Coin looks better on paper than Morgana + Spellthief, if you want a lot of harass, Morgana will be the better choice.

Maybe that means that the matchups where you need Janna are easier than the matchups where you need Morgana. It shouldn't ever be the difference between Morgana being the right/wrong pick for a particular matchup, though.

Could Spellthief use a buff? Sure. But it's FAR from causing the champs who prefer it to be trash.

The frost queen item is terrible though

The GP10 is the same so you don't get any extra gold from that
{{item:3303}}  2 GP10 + 5 gold per proc
{{item:3098}}  2 GP10 + 10 gold per proc (+5 gold per proc this is what you get for upgrading it and spending 500 gold)

Which means that the only extra gold you get from upgrading it is 5 extra gold per proc
and the item cost 500 gold and that obviously means that you need 100 procs to make back your gold

And 100 procs takes at leasy 1000 seconds (10 second per charge) or 16.6 minutes

however it is impossible to use charges all the time so it will take longer and will likely take between 20-30 min after you bought {{item:3098}}  for it to pay for itself

i usually just buy spellthiefs and sell it much later in the game. my main ap support is {{champion:37}} and she can use it quite effectively. it usually racks up 500-600 gold in total, combined with the stats and the burst increase you get which is nice on her (if you didnt know, when you proc the passive you also deal 10 or so extra damage) its a pretty good start. the 10 damage is useless mid-late game and selling it for a bit of gold and a slot is much better. i definately agree the blue line could get some love {{item:3303}}{{item:3098}}{{item:3092}}

You speak as though I don't like Sona myself.  If you hadn't bothered jumping to conclusions and unjustifiably resorting to crude insults, I could have told you I joined LoL to play Sona and mained her for the entirety of season 3.  As much as I wish Sona were a playable champion, I can't deny facts.  Patch 4.13 gutted her beyond recognition and this isn't the first instance in time when players are being reported for picking a champion.  Evelynn after she was gutted(the first and previous times), Bard for two patches after his released, Udyr and et cetera.  Nothing I've said is biased or untrue, you're just too close-minded to realize it.

Maybe Sona isn't as good as Alistar or Thresh, but she is still extremely viable. 

She also has 52.7% WR with a 4.95% play rate. She could use some buffs, but regardless, she is fine.

Ali and Thresh also get picked 10.3% and 25.91% of the time, respectively.  So it's understandable that with that much larger of a pool, the winrates would be slightly lower than a support that is picked half as much (in the case of Ali) or less and is probably only played by people who main her.  So yes, Ali and Thresh are better than Sona; the comparable winrates are just skewed by uneven sample sizes.
Which is why it's nice that the stats are broken up into "games played"- with the 1-5 games played crew running at a 50% win rate.

In solo queue though? Pick her. Why not? Most of us will never see the LCS let alone Challenger 5v5s, so...play what you enjoy if it can work...which Sona can.

Sure this meta seems to favor the likes of Alistar, or Nautilus, but not a thing wrong with Sona.

That doesn't mean squishy supports like Morgana, Sona, and Nami can't work. Not every position HAS to be a tank. It's a team comp thing. She does better when she can follow-up on stuns and knock ups like Malphite and Amumu, from my experience. You can slap on a tank anywhere, but that doesn't mean Sona doesn't work.

Actually Morgana works well with all these tanks running around
Since tanks often rely on and bring a lot of CC
Which obviously Morgana black shield is good against

If you are just concerned about the gold {{item:3303}}  is probably the best
As while {{item:3098}}  gives more gold.... it cost 500 gold and for you to gain 500 extra gold from it you need to proc the passive 100 times which will take 1000 seconds or 16.6 minutes (and that is if you never sit at 3 stacks.. for each second you sit at 3 stacks it will take one second longer to pay for itself)

Obviously you aren't able to proc frostfang all the time so it will pretty much always take at least 20-25 min for it to pay for itself and then it would usually be better to just go directly to other better items instead of delaying them to get frostfang first

As someone who frequents Nami support a lot, I enjoy the crap out of {{item:3092}} . 

In its early stages it rewards you for poking the enemy, combined with masteries you can easily earn 10 gold every time you trade with an enemy champion.

And then when it has reached its final form it's an extremely potent slow that makes landing the rest of your kit so easy it feels like cheating. This method does require you to build a bit tankier than some people like, but so long as you hit that 200 AP mark you've got enough AP; and to boot, the enemy will absolutely not be dodging your bubble or ult if you land the FQC active.

Agreed. Frostfang needs more gold/10. Or just something. but {{item:3092}}  is still a very good support item. not much needs to be changed except that it is very hard to earn gold with it mid-late game if you're playing someone like Janna that needs to stay in the back most of the time.

Janna shouldn't be buying it anyway, she has bad poke and needs to stay in the back.  She should stick with coin.

I think they should improve the active -- range, aoe, missile speed -- it just seems really awkward to actually land on anyone, and makes it not at all attractive to pursue upgrading (to the point that many people here are saying they don't upgrade it and just sell it, possibly buying talisman in its place).

It is used for poke in the laning phase with your auto attacks. And the 50 AP is +5 attack dmg and like 83 more hp for your shield. Ap is very very useful on Janna and the 40% slow is great because Janna is so fast that she can walk up and never miss it then combo them and they'll die from being cc'd so long. 
Talisman is much more gold efficient now. Except that it won't win you half of the lanes you play. You only buy Talisman for sustain lanes or against early gank junglers. Everything else you get Frostqueens to win the lane and or to stack more ap depending on match ups..
Yep. You buy Spell Thief and sell it if the game goes so long you need that slot. I don't see any advantages to upgrading it over starting other items personally.

The gold generation is fine. The problem is that it doesn't build into anything useful. If they replaced the Frost Queen active with something useful (maybe a targeted cleanse, or a tenacity aura?), it would be worth it.
It would be useful if you could hit it, but as a short ranged, slow skillshot with a small area, it has a really hard time comparing to talisman's large area buff or Face's *targeted* buff.
